title: Govt. doubles up measures for deal with Qatar for petroleum purchases
byline: In a bid to avert any energy crisis in the future, the government is hurriedly taking measures to purchase both petroleum products, including LNG (Liquefied Natural Gas) from Qatar under a government-to-government agreement, an official said.

title: Fuel distributors warn of shortage from today
byline: While disputing the statement made by Ceylon Petroleum Corporation (CPC) Chairman stating that there would be no fuel shortage this week, the Fuel Distributors’ Association said that no fuel orders had been placed since Friday and the public were warned to expect a shortage from today.

title: Central Province issues guidelines for events attended by Governor
byline: The Central Province Chief Secretary’s office issued a letter today outlining measures to be followed during functions attended by the Central Province Governor.

title: Air Vice Marshal Sumanaweera to be appointed SLAF Chief of Staff
byline: Air Vice Marshal Lasitha Sumanaweera will be appointed as the new Chief of Staff of the Sri Lanka Air Force (SLAF), effective tomorrow.

title: Indian Naval ship Kuthar visits Colombo to strengthen maritime cooperation
byline: Indian Naval Ship Kuthar, an indigenously built Khukri class Corvette arrived Colombo port today for three days visit.

title: Minister defends monkey scuffle theory amid blackout controversy
byline: Energy Minister Kumara Jayakody reaffirmed that no one had ruled out that a monkey scuffle caused the recent all-island blackout on February 18.

title: New Electricity Amendment Bill to be introduced soon: Minister
byline: The New Electricity Amendment Bill will be introduced soon under which the division of the Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) will be done away with, Minister of Trade Wasantha Samarasinghe told Parliament today.

title: Thousands evacuated as Japan’s biggest fire in decades continues to burn
byline: Japan has deployed more than 2,000 firefighters to battle the country’s biggest forest fire in three decades.

title: Other two suspects arrested over Ganemulle Sanjeewa’s murder remanded
byline: Colombo Chief Magistrate Thanuja Lakmali today remanded another two suspects arrested over the murder of Ganemulla Sanjeewa at the Colombo Cheif Magistrate’s Court, till 7 March, 2025.

title: FR petition filed to prevent elephant-train collisions
byline: A Fundamental Rights petition was filed before the Supreme Court seeking an order directing the authorities to develop a comprehensive plan to mitigate elephant-train collisions in Sri Lanka.

title: Three suspects remanded for defrauding cancer patients
byline: Three suspects, arrested for allegedly defrauding cancer patients by falsely promising financial assistance and fraudulently transferring over Rs. 2.2 million from their bank accounts using forged identity documents, have been remanded today (03) till March 17, 2025, by Colombo Chief Magistrate Thanuja Lakmali.

title: Sri Lanka welcomes over 485,000 tourists in early 2025
byline: Maintaining the strong momentum stemming from the record tourist arrivals in 2024, Sri Lanka has recorded a total of 485,102 tourist arrivals from January 1st to February 27th, 2025.

title: Trump makes English official language of US
byline: President Donald Trump has signed an executive order making English the official language of the United States.

title: Doctors threaten island-wide strike
byline: The Government Medical Officers’ Association (GMOA) has warned of an island-wide strike starting from March 5 if the government fails to address concerns over reductions in additional duty and holiday allowances for government doctors.

title: Deputy Minister blames Opposition for fuel crisis
byline: Coming up with a number of disclosures in Parliament, Deputy Minister Arun Hemachandra today alleged that the Opposition is behind the fuel distribution crisis that is prevailing at the moment.

title: Energy Minister, Opposition MP clash in Parliament
byline: Power and Energy Minister Kumara Jayakodi and Opposition MP Chamara Samapth Dassanayake clashed in Parliament over the recent power breakdown.

title: Van crash injures 14 schoolchildren
byline: Fourteen schoolchildren, aged between 11 and 14, were hospitalized after a van crashed into a tree in the Kuruwita area early this morning.

title: PHI remanded for soliciting bribe to renew trade license
byline: A Public Health Inspector (PHI) from Galewela, accused of soliciting and accepting a bribe of Rs. 200,000 from a businessman to renew a trade license, has been remanded today till March 11 by Colombo Chief Magistrate Thanuja Lakmali.

title: Two ex-officials of ‘Maganaguma’ accused of misappropriation granted bail
byline: Two former officials of the Maganaguma Development Department, who were arrested for allegedly facilitating the misappropriation of public funds allocated for development projects during 2012-2015, were ordered to be released on bail today by Colombo Chief Magistrate Thanuja Lakmali considering the health condition of the suspects.

title: CID probe into attempt to create fuel shortage
byline: The Criminal Investigation Department (CID) has launched an investigation into an alleged attempt to create a fuel shortage by halting orders from the Ceylon Petroleum Corporation (CPC), police said.

title: Nominations for LG elections open
byline: Nominations for the upcoming Local Government Elections will be accepted from March 17, 2025 to March 20, 2025, the Elections Commission announced.

title: Train schedules revised to prevent elephant-train collisions
byline: In a bid to reduce elephant-train collisions, Sri Lanka Railways has introduced revised train schedules and new speed limits for night operations in areas where elephant crossings are frequent.

title: LG polls in first week of May?
byline: The Local Government (LG) elections are likely to be held in the first week of May, Daily Mirror learns.

title: One dead, 726 affected by adverse weather
byline: One person died due to a lightning strike and 726 people from 178 families have been affected in five districts due to the prevailing adverse weather, the Disaster Management Centre (DMC) said

title: The full list of Oscar winners and nominees
byline: The Academy Awards have taken place in Los Angeles, with Anora scooping the most honours, while Conclave, The Brutalist, Wicked and Emilia Pérez also took prizes.

title: Air quality good in most cities
byline: A good level of air quality was recorded in most cities, while a moderate level was observed in Jaffna, Kurunegala, Galle, and Puttalam, the Vehicular Emission Test Trust Fund of the Department of Motor Traffic said.

title: ’National Women’s Week’ declared
byline: In line with International Women’s Day, which falls on March 8, the Ministry of Women and Child Affairs has declared a ’National Women’s Week’ to commemorate this significant occasion.

title: Electricity tariff cut brings consumer prices further down in February
byline: Sizeable cut to electricity tariffs in the third week of January brought consumer prices in the Colombo district further down in February.

title: Build resilience as economy stabilises, CBSL tells private sector
byline: As Sri Lanka transitions from economic stabilisation to growth acceleration following its worst economic crisis in 2022,
